definition: to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct
all/both/entirely/(used for emphasis) even/already/(not) at all

sentences.english: The Yuan Dynasty established its capital in Dadu, now Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 元代建都于大都，即今之北京。

sentences.english: Fuxi lived here 6500 years ago and set the capital in this city.
sentences.chinese: 伏羲生活在年前并在淮阳建都。

sentences.english: Sixteen Kingdoms period, the Northern Yan in Dingzhou its capital.
sentences.chinese: 十六国时期，北燕在定州建都。

sentences.english: All which glitters is not gold.
sentences.chinese: 闪光的不一建都是金子。

sentences.english: Chapter One is mainly found on Ying Capital's location and age to the study.
sentences.chinese: 第一章主要是关于郢都建都地望及年代的研究。

sentences.english: Bll that glitters is not gold.
sentences.chinese: 闪光的纷歧建都是金子。

sentences.english: All stuffs are difficult ago we are easy.
sentences.chinese: 闪光的不一建都是金子。

definition: provisional capital of a country (e.g. in time of war)/secondary capital/alternative capital
official name of a nation (includes dynastic names of China: 漢|汉[Han4], 唐[Tang2] etc)
Later Jin of the Five Dynasties (936-946)
Xia dynasty, unconfirmed but placed at c. 2070-c. 1600 BC
Later Tang of the Five Dynasties (923-936)
Later Han or Eastern Han dynasty (25-220)/Later Han of the Five Dynasties (947-950)
